headline: Anticipating Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
snippet: The singer’s 12th album is being teased as a pivot back to pop bangers. On Popcast, we break down why (and why she announced it the way she did).

headline: Breaking Down Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
snippet: For a rapid-response episode of Popcast, we journeyed track-by-track through the pop star’s new album, assessing the highs, lows and hot gossip.

headline: Taylor Swift Announces New Album, ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
snippet: The singer-songwriter revealed the name of her 12th original studio album in a surprise announcement, but no other details.

headline: In Taylor’s Version, Ophelia Has a Fairy-Tale Ending
snippet: Taylor Swift reimagines the fate of the tragic “Hamlet” heroine on her new album, “The Life of a Showgirl.” But did she really need saving?

headline: Why Is Taylor Swift So Polarizing? And Other Big ‘Showgirl’ Questions
snippet: Our team of Swift experts debate her blockbuster new album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” and take listener questions about its themes and controversies.

headline: Taylor Swift Keeps Getting Bigger. Can the Music Keep Up?
snippet: “The Life of a Showgirl” dominated streaming, conversation and movie theaters this weekend. But reaction to the album — especially its lyrics — was mixed.

headline: A Taylor Swift Mystery: Which Musso and Frank’s Booth Is ‘Best’?
snippet: The pop star name dropped the storied Hollywood restaurant on her new album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” and the restaurant confirmed she is a customer. But which booth does she prefer?

headline: When Did You Know Taylor Swift Would Be a Pop Superstar?
snippet: Look back at six pivotal moments as the singer and songwriter prepares to release her 12th original studio album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”

headline: Taylor Swift Conquered With the Eras Tour. Now Comes the Victory Lap.
snippet: The star’s power and reach has grown with each of her releases. Now she’s following her record-breaking live show with her 12th original studio LP, “The Life of a Showgirl.”

headline: Taylor Swift Fans Try to Decode ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
snippet: Speculation abounds as to which songs have references to the various celebrities in Ms. Swift’s life.

headline: When Taylor Swift Met Pop’s Supreme Hitmaker, Max Martin
snippet: The pop star and the Swedish producer connected on her 2012 LP, “Red.” They’ve reunited (with his collaborator Shellback) for “The Life of a Showgirl.”

headline: Taylor Swift’s Latest Reinvention Is Both Coarse and Conservative
snippet: Coarseness and conservative impulses in “The Life of a Showgirl.”

headline: Taylor Swift takes album of the year, becoming the first woman to win three times.
snippet: The singer-songwriter’s pandemic album “Folklore” joins “Fearless” and “1989” as winners of the Grammys’ biggest prize for an LP.

headline: When Taylor Swift Met Pop’s Supreme Hitmaker, Max Martin
snippet: The pop star and the Swedish producer connected on her 2012 LP, “Red.” They’ve reunited (with his collaborator Shellback) for “The Life of a Showgirl.”

headline: Taylor Swift Earns Her Fourth No. 1 in 16 Months With New ‘Red’
snippet: “Red (Taylor’s Version)” had the equivalent of 605,000 sales in the United States. On next week’s album chart, Adele’s “30” may reach one million sales.

headline: Taylor Swift and Phoebe Bridgers’s ‘Red’ Duet, and 14 More New Songs
snippet: Hear tracks by Beyoncé, Let’s Eat Grandma, Beach House and others.

headline: Taylor Swift Is Back on Top of the Charts
snippet: Ms. Swift’s latest album, “Red,” returned to the top of the chart in its seventh week.

headline: No More Kid Stuff for Taylor Swift
snippet: On her new album, “Red,” Ms. Swift, now 22, finally begins to sound like an adult.

headline: Taylor Swift Returns to No. 1 With Autographed ‘Fearless’ CDs
snippet: The singer-songwriter’s “Fearless (Taylor’s Version),” the rerecorded edition of her breakthrough 2008 LP, surged to the top of Billboard’s album chart.

headline: Taylor Swift Remade ‘Fearless’ as ‘Taylor’s Version.’ Let’s Discuss.
snippet: Keeping a promise from when her master recordings were sold, Swift has faithfully rerecorded her 2008 album. Our critics and reporters explore its sound, and purpose.

headline: Taylor Swift takes album of the year, becoming the first woman to win three times.
snippet: The singer-songwriter’s pandemic album “Folklore” joins “Fearless” and “1989” as winners of the Grammys’ biggest prize for an LP.

headline: Taylor Swift’s Rerecorded Album Releases Begin With ‘Fearless’ in April
snippet: After her first six albums were sold to investors, Swift said she would record entirely new versions of her old songs that she would own.

headline: Taylor Swift Lands Her Second No. 1 Album of the Year With ‘Evermore’
snippet: The sequel to “Folklore” did not have the commercial impact of its predecessor, due in part to changes in the Billboard rules.

headline: ‘Evermore,’ Taylor Swift’s ‘Folklore’ Sequel, Is a Journey Deeper Inward
snippet: The singer and songwriter’s July album traded glossy sheen for an acoustic-Minimalistic palette. A second album with the same collaborators moves even further from her pop past.

headline: Taylor Swift Announces Second Surprise Quarantine Album, ‘Evermore’
snippet: The “sister record” to her Grammy-nominated “Folklore” again features Aaron Dessner, Jack Antonoff and Justin Vernon, along with new collaborators.

headline: Taylor Swift Lands Her Second No. 1 Album of the Year With ‘Evermore’
snippet: The sequel to “Folklore” did not have the commercial impact of its predecessor, due in part to changes in the Billboard rules.

headline: ‘Evermore,’ Taylor Swift’s ‘Folklore’ Sequel, Is a Journey Deeper Inward
snippet: The singer and songwriter’s July album traded glossy sheen for an acoustic-Minimalistic palette. A second album with the same collaborators moves even further from her pop past.

headline: Taylor Swift Announces Second Surprise Quarantine Album, ‘Evermore’
snippet: The “sister record” to her Grammy-nominated “Folklore” again features Aaron Dessner, Jack Antonoff and Justin Vernon, along with new collaborators.

headline: Taylor Swift takes album of the year, becoming the first woman to win three times.
snippet: The singer-songwriter’s pandemic album “Folklore” joins “Fearless” and “1989” as winners of the Grammys’ biggest prize for an LP.

headline: Taylor Swift Rejoins Her ‘Folklore’ Crew, and 8 More New Songs
snippet: Hear tracks by Brent Faiyaz featuring Drake, J. Balvin and Skrillex, Chicano Batman and others.

headline: Taylor Swift and the Wisdom of Youth
snippet: “Folklore,” the album that earned five of Swift’s six Grammy nominations, is stocked with references to the specific, oft-denigrated insight of teenagers.

headline: ‘Evermore,’ Taylor Swift’s ‘Folklore’ Sequel, Is a Journey Deeper Inward
snippet: The singer and songwriter’s July album traded glossy sheen for an acoustic-Minimalistic palette. A second album with the same collaborators moves even further from her pop past.

headline: Taylor Swift Announces Second Surprise Quarantine Album, ‘Evermore’
snippet: The “sister record” to her Grammy-nominated “Folklore” again features Aaron Dessner, Jack Antonoff and Justin Vernon, along with new collaborators.

headline: Grammys 2021: Women Sweep Awards Shaped by Pandemic and Protest
snippet: Beyoncé broke a record, Megan Thee Stallion and H.E.R. won awards, Taylor Swift’s “Folklore” was named album of the year and Billie Eilish’s “Everything I Wanted” record of the year.

snippet: The singer-songwriter’s pandemic album “Folklore” joins “Fearless” and “1989” as winners of the Grammys’ biggest prize for an LP.

headline: Taylor Swift Never Rerecorded ‘Reputation.’ Thank God.
snippet: After buying back her master recordings, the superstar says she has no plans to finish remaking her sixth album — her most inventive, shocking and risky yet.

headline: Taylor Swift Begins Her ‘Reputation’ Tour, Taking on Foes and Her Old Self
snippet: The singer’s “Reputation” stadium tour sought to complete her transformation from warm pop superstar to something more coldblooded.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Has Arrived. Let’s Discuss.
snippet: Ms. Swift plays a different game on her sixth album — making pop music that directly competes with the rest of the field’s dominant players. A panel discussion, on Popcast.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Is Almost Here. Let’s Discuss.
snippet: She hasn’t done interviews, but the pop star has been leaving hints about what to expect on her sixth album. Our writers listen to the signs, on Popcast.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Takes Back No. 1 on the Chart
snippet: This is the fourth time her album has returned to Billboard’s top spot. She was followed by Ed Sheeran at No. 2 and Huncho Jack at No. 3.

headline: Luke Bryan Is Latest Challenger to Hold Off Taylor Swift for No. 1
snippet: Last week U2 bumped Ms. Swift’s “Reputation” from the top spot after three weeks. And this week Luke Bryan hits No. 1 with “What Makes You Country.”

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Spends a Third Week at No. 1
snippet: The singer also released the album to streaming services, which may give it a second wind next week when it faces a challenge from U2’s new record.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Is No. 1 Again, but Will It Maintain Its Momentum?
snippet: After a debut tally of 1.2 million, the singer’s latest album sold the equivalent of 256,000 in its second week.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Sells 925,000 Copies in 3 Days
snippet: From Friday through Sunday, Ms. Swift’s latest album had already achieved by far the best opening week of any 2017 release.

headline: Taylor Swift’s ‘Reputation’ Sells 1.2 Million Copies in Its First Week
snippet: This is the pop singer’s fourth consecutive album to sell more than one million copies right off the bat.

snippet: The singer-songwriter’s pandemic album “Folklore” joins “Fearless” and “1989” as winners of the Grammys’ biggest prize for an LP.
